input_text:
Job Title: CAD Administrator

Location: Grenada, MS

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
At Modine, we are engineering a cleaner, healthier world. Building on more than 100 years of excellence in thermal management, we provide trusted systems and solutions that improve air quality and conserve natural resources. More than 13,000 employees are at work in every corner of the globe, delivering the solutions our customers need, where they need them. Our Climate Solutions and Performance Technologies segments support our purpose by improving air quality, reducing energy and water consumption, lowering harmful emissions and enabling cleaner running vehicles and environmentally-friendly refrigerants. Modine is a global company headquartered in Racine, Wisconsin (USA), with operations in North America, South America, Europe and Asia. For more information about Modine, visit www.modine.com.

Position Description

Modine Manufacturing Company in Grenada, Mississippi is hiring for an experienced CAD professional to join our Data Center team! This position will oversee CAD operations for the Data Center vertical and ensure that all CAD projects are completed accurately and efficiently. This position will also assist with the transfer projects to ensure regional differences are addressed in the model and drawing templates.

This position is onsite at our plant in Grenada, Mississippi and operates under typical business hours. The CAD Administrator will report to the CAD Supervisor in the plant.

Key Responsibilities

Maintain multiple CAD systems rules and settings ensuring that they are functioning correctly and are up-to-date. SolidEdge and SolidWorks.Align with other regions on design transfer projects.Provide technical support and training to end-users.Ensure that all CAD data is correctly managed, stored, and version controlled.Work with engineering teams to establish and maintain CAD standards.Provide CAD technical support and assistance to engineering teams.Create and maintain CAD templates and libraries.Manage the installation, configuration and update of new software add-ins (i.e. Macros, external automation tools, etc)Create design rules and workflows to be followed by design and engineering teamLiaison between other facilities in regards to CAD practices and commonization (Grenada MS, Rockbridge VA, Leeds UK, etc)

Required Education & Qualifications

At least 3 years of experience working with CAD packages and systems, particularly SolidEdge or SolidWorks.Experience with PDM (Product Data Management) Systems.Working knowledge of engineering and drafting standards and how those apply to CAD operations.Project management skills to manage multiple projects at once.Working knowledge of Microsoft Office products.At minimum, an associate’s degree in a technical field combined with some experience is required. A bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, computer science, or a related field would be beneficial.

Modine is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Modine provides a competitive benefit package, which could include paid vacation, short term disability, 401(k), health, dental, vision, life insurance, flex spending benefits, tuition reimbursement, Health Savings Account and much more. Human Resources will provide more detail upon your hiring.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
